item.title: Live: Scores of civilians reach safety as Russia renews assault on Mariupol plant
item.description: Ukraine say Russian forces have launched a "powerful assault" on the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, where more than 200 civilians are still holed up with Ukrainian fighters, according to the city's mayor. Humanitarian workers say around 100 civilians have successfully been evacuated from the plant and are now in the Ukrainian-controlled city of Zaporizhzhia. Follow FRANCE 24’s liveblog for all the latest developments. All times are Paris time (GMT+2).
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: French left 'a few steps' from broad alliance to counter Macron in parliamentary polls
item.description: France's left-of-centre parties were on Tuesday close to a broad alliance for June parliamentary polls, hoping that a united front can force President Emmanuel Macron to share power with the left during his second term in office.
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Rethinking the EU: The young Europeans reshaping a continent
item.description: Since May 2021, the Conference on the Future of Europe has been tasked with pitching ideas to EU leaders about how the bloc should function. It is an unprecedented exercise in participatory democracy, giving European citizens a chance to make their voices heard.

item.title: Al Shabaab militants storm African Union base in Somalia, killing several
item.description: Al-Shabaab jihadists armed with guns and explosives stormed an African Union base in Somalia on Tuesday, triggering a fierce firefight that killed an unknown number of Burundian peacekeepers.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: France’s conservatives torn over Macron’s ‘siren call’ before parliamentary polls
item.description: France’s traditional conservative party Les Républicains (LR) was humiliated in last month’s presidential elections, squeezed between the biggest voting blocs on the centre right and far right. Now LR’s leading figures are rowing over the prospect of joining forces with Emmanuel Macron as the president is expected to maintain his majority in June’s parliamentary vote.
item.dc:creator: Tom WHEELDON

item.title: Liverpool see off Villarreal 3-2 to reach Champions League final
item.description: Liverpool held off a stirring comeback from Villarreal to reach the Champions League final on Tuesday as second-half goals from Fabinho, Luis Diaz and Sadio Mane secured a 5-2 aggregate victory.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: US Supreme Court says draft opinion on overturning abortion rights is authentic
item.description: The head of the Supreme Court on Tuesday confirmed the authenticity of a leaked draft that has fuelled speculation the court is poised to strike down the right to abortion in the United States, in a staggering blow to women's rights.
item.source: Getty Images via AFP - ANNA MONEYMAKER
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: France says Mali’s decision to quit defence accords won’t affect withdrawal plans
item.description: Mali's decision to renounce a military cooperation agreement with France after it fell out with the ruling junta is "unjustified" and would not affect the military withdrawal, a French foreign ministry spokesman said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: World Health Organization warns of obesity 'epidemic' in Europe
item.description: The WHO said Tuesday that "epidemic" overweight and obesity rates are linked to over 1.2 million deaths annually across Europe, calling for swift policy changes to reverse the dangerous trend.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Armenia detains hundreds of anti-govt protesters as opposition calls for PM to resign
item.description: Police in Armenia on Tuesday detained more than 200 anti-government protesters as opposition parties up pressure on Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan over his handling of a territorial dispute with Azerbaijan.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Russian troops killing civilians in Central African Republic, rights group says
item.description: Human Rights Watch on Tuesday said there was "compelling evidence" that Russian paramilitary troops were committing serious rights abuses and killing civilians in the Central African Republic.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Online content fuelling divisions and global tensions, media watchdog says
item.description: Unregulated online content has spread disinformation and propaganda that have amplified political divisions worldwide, fanned international tensions and even contributed to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a media watchdog warned Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Tunisia announces 'national dialogue', excluding opposition groups
item.description: Tunisian President Kais Saied has announced the launch of "national dialogue" to help resolve a political crisis following his controversial power grab, but excluding critical opposition groups.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: How pro-Russian bloggers are covering the war in Ukraine
item.description: Russian bloggers with hundreds of thousands of followers have been publishing reports from the city of Mariupol, in southeastern Ukraine. Embedded in Russian military units, they film videos close to the action, capturing the intense fighting that has been raging in the port city for weeks. On Telegram, they publish these videos to share a pro-Kremlin narrative of the war, which sometimes borders on disinformation.

item.title: Mali junta breaks off from defence accords with France
item.description: Mali’s ruling junta announced on Monday it was breaking off from its defence accords with former colonial ruler France, condemning “flagrant violations” of its national sovereignty by the French troops there.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: French Greens, leftist Mélenchon form alliance ahead of parliamentary elections
item.description: Momentum was building on Monday behind attempts by French left-wing parties to form a united front against President Emmanuel Macron in next month's parliamentary elections, after radical Jean-Luc Mélenchon clinched a deal with the Greens.
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Spanish PM’s mobile phone infected by Pegasus malware
item.description: The cellphones of Spain's prime minister and defense minister were infected last year with Pegasus spyware, which is available only to countries' government agencies, authorities announced Monday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Civilians attempt evacuation from Ukraine’s besieged Mariupol
item.description: Ukrainian authorities attempted further evacuations from Mariupol on Monday, following an initial operation to remove around 100 civilians from the besieged Azovstal steel plant. Meanwhile, in Brussels, EU energy ministers held emergency talks as the bloc considers a phasing out of Russian oil imports. Read about the day’s events as they unfolded on our liveblog. All times are Paris time (GMT+2).
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: Outrage in Israel as Russia's Lavrov claims Hitler had Jewish roots
item.description: Israel lambasted Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Monday for claiming that Adolf Hitler was part Jewish, saying it was an "unforgivable" falsehood that debased the horrors of the Nazi Holocaust.
item.source: © Russian foreign ministry press service via AP
item.dc:creator: FRANCE 24

item.title: India and Germany pledge climate cooperation, differ over Ukraine war
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pledged 10 billion euros ($10.51 billion) to help India achieve its climate goals after meeting its Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Berlin on Monday, but the leaders remained far apart in their stance on the Ukraine war.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES

item.title: Russia thrown out of women's Euro, banned from European club football next season
item.description: UEFA has banned Russia from the Women's European Championship in July and from participating in qualifying for next year's World Cup following the country's invasion of Ukraine, European soccer's governing body said on Monday.
item.dc:creator: NEWS WIRES
